unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: Changes in $t$-distribution with Decrease of D.O.F.
question_text: Which of the following correctly describes the changes in the $t$-distribution when the degrees of freedom decreases?

choices.text: The center decreases, the spread increases and the shape becomes less normal.
The center decreases, the spread increases and the shape becomes more normal.
The center increases, the spread decreases and the shape becomes less normal.
The center remains the same, the spread decreases and the shape becomes more normal.
The center remains the same, the spread increases and the shape becomes less normal.

solution:
The $t$-distribution is centered at zero for all degrees of freedom. At low degrees of freedom, the $t$-distribution has a lower peak and larger tails creating a larger spread. As the degrees of freedom increases, the $t$-distribution becomes more normal with smaller tails, creating a smaller spread.

So, as the degrees of freedom decrease, the center remains the same, the spread increases and the shape becomes less normal. Choice 'E' is correct.

Explanation of Distractors

Choices 'A', 'B', and 'C' are incorrect because the center will not change.

Choice 'D' is incorrect because as degrees of freedom decreases, the spread will increase and the shape will become less and less normal. Otherwise, we would seek to have less degrees of freedom rather than more in a study!
